ds.util
Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.Arrays

public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains methods for searching, sorting, and listing the elements in an array.

For the basic searching and sorting methods, the class features versions for int arrays and for generic array with a specified type.

The general sort method includes a version with a Comparator argument that controls the order (ascending or descending) of the sort

See Also:
Comparator

Method Detail

selectionSort

public static void selectionSort(int[] arr)
Sorts an array of integer values in ascending order using the selection sort algorithm.

This algorithm has O(n*n) runtime efficiency for best, worst, and average case.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.

selectionSort

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> void selectionSort(T[] arr)
A generic version of the selection sort algorithm that orders an array of elements of type T in ascending order. The algorithm requires that the generic type implements the Comparable interface.

This algorithm has O(n*n) runtime efficiency for best, worst, and average case.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.

insertionSort

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> void insertionSort(T[] arr)
A generic version of the insertion sort algorithm that orders an array of elements of type T in ascending order. The algorithm requires that the generic type implements the Comparable interface.

This algorithm has O(n*n) runtime efficiency for best, worst, and average case.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.

radixSort

public static void radixSort(int[] arr,
                             int d)
Sorts an array of integer values in ascending order using the radix sort algorithm; the parameter d is an upper bound on the digit size of an element.

This algorithm has O(n*d) runtime efficiency.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.
d - upper bound on the digit size of an element..

sort

public static void sort(java.lang.Object[] arr)
Sorts the specified array of objects into ascending order using the Comparble method compareTo() to order the elements.

The sorting algorithm is mergesort which offers guaranteed O(n*log(n)) performance.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.

sort

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> void sort(T[] arr)
A generic sort the orders an array of elements of type T into ascending order using the Comparble method compareTo() to order the elements.

The sorting algorithm is mergesort which offers guaranteed O(n*log(n)) performance.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.

sort

public static <T> void sort(T[] arr,
                            Comparator<? super T> comp)
A generic sort the orders an array of elements of type T into ascending order using the Comparator comp to provide the natural ordering of elements.

The sorting algorithm is mergesort which offers guaranteed O(n*log(n)) performance.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.
comp - a Comparator that provides the natural ordering of elements.

pivotIndex

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> int pivotIndex(T[] arr,
                                                                         int first,
                                                                         int last)
Partitions array elements in the range [first, last) about the pivot and returns the index of the resulting pivot position. Elements in the lower sublist are less than or equal to the pivot value and elements in the upper sublist are greater than or equal to the pivot.

Parameters:
arr - array to paritition.
first - starting index for the sublist.
last - upper bound for the sublist.
Returns:
index of the pivot value after partitioning the array sublist.

quicksort

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> void quicksort(T[] arr)
The generic quicksort algorithm that orders an array of elements of type T into ascending order using the Comparble method compareTo() to order the elements.

The sorting algorithm has runtime efficiency O(n*log(n)) for the average case..

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.

                                                                       int first,

                                                                       int k)

heapSort

public static <T> void heapSort(T[] arr,
                                Comparator<? super T> comp)
The generic heapSort the orders an array of elements of type T into ascending order using the Comparator comp to provide the natural ordering of elements. If comp is an instance of Greater, the array is sorted in ascending order. If comp is an instance of Lessthe array is sorted in descending order.

The sorting algorithm is has runtime efficiency O(n*log(n)) for the average case..

Parameters:
arr - the array to be sorted.
comp - a Comparator that provides order for the sort; An instance of Greater sorts in ascending order; an instance of Lesssorts in descending order.

seqSearch

public static int seqSearch(int[] arr,
                            int first,
                            int last,
                            int target)
Searches the sublist [first, last) in an integer array for the specified target value using the sequential search algorithm; the return value is the first occurrence of a match or -1 if not match is found.

Parameters:
arr - the integer array to be searched.
first - starting index for the sublist.
last - upper bound for the sublist.
target - the search key to locate in the sublist.
Returns:
index of the search key, if it is contained in the list; otherwise, - 1.

seqSearch

public static int seqSearch(java.lang.Object[] arr,
                            int first,
                            int last,
                            java.lang.Object target)
Searches the sublist [first, last) in a specified array of objects for the specified target value using the sequential search algorithm; comparison is made using the equals() method; the return value is the first occurrence of a match or -1 if not match is found.

Parameters:
arr - the array to be searched.
first - starting index for the sublist.
last - upper bound for the sublist.
target - the search key to locate in the sublist.
Returns:
index of the search key, if it is contained in the list; otherwise, - 1.

binSearch

public static int binSearch(int[] arr,
                            int first,
                            int last,
                            int target)
Searches an integer array for the specified target value using the binary search algorithm. The array must be sorted into ascending order.

Parameters:
arr - the integer array to be searched.
first - starting index for the sublist.
last - upper bound for the sublist.
target - the search key to locate in the sublist.
Returns:
index of the search key, if it is contained in the list; otherwise, - 1.

Searches the sublist [first, last) in a specified array of objects for the specified target value using the binary search algorithm; the generic type T must implement the Comparable interface with the array sorted in ascending order; comparison is made using the equals() method; the return value is the first occurrence of a match or -1 if not match is found. search algorithm.

Parameters:
arr - the integer array to be searched.
first - starting index for the sublist.
last - upper bound for the sublist.
target - the search key to locate in the sublist.
Returns:

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object[] arr)
Returns a string that displays the elements in the array in sequential order. The description is a comma separated list of elements enclosed in brackets.

Returns:
string that contains the list of elements in the array.
